topic_or_construct: Child sexual abuse allegation truth probability
measured_by: Finnish Investigative Instrument of Child Sexual Abuse (FICSA)
justification: The article explains that "This classifier, called FICSA (Finnish Investigative Instrument of Child Sexual Abuse)… [is used] to calculate the probability of a CSA allegation being true or false," directly linking the construct (probability the allegation is true) to the FICSA measure.

It states that "All variables were selected from a pool of approximately 1,000 variables used to study the life of over 11,000 Finnish children and their experience with crime conducted in 2013 (Ellonen et al., 2013)," referring to the Child Victim Survey dataset that systematically measures children’s experiences of victimization.
